tit.j: 丸太町駅 (京都市営地下鉄)

sen.j: 丸太町駅（まるたまちえき）は、京都府京都市中京区にある、京都市営地下鉄京都市営地下鉄烏丸線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Marutamachi Station is a stop on the Karasuma Line, which is operated by Kyoto City Subway
sen.cmt: ”京都市営地下鉄京都市営地下鉄”：”京都市営地下鉄”がだぶっていると考え、一方を削除したとして訳してあります。
sen.e: Marutamachi Station, located in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Karasuma Line, which is operated by Kyoto City Subway.
Marutamachi Station, located in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Karasuma Line, which is operated by Kyoto Municipal Subway.

sen.j: 駅番号はK07。
sen.e: The station number is K07.
The station number is K07.
The station number is K07.

sen.j: 駅名は、烏丸線と交叉する、丸太町通に由来する。
sen.e: The station is named after Marutamachi-dori Street that crosses Karasuma Line.
The station is named after Marutamachi-dori Street, which crosses the Karasuma Line.
The station is named after Marutamachi-dori Street, which crosses the Karasuma Line.

tit.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 烏丸通丸太町通交差点の地下に位置する、プラットホーム1面2線の地下駅。
sen.e: This station is located in the underground of the crossing of Karasuma-dori Street and Marutamachi-dori Street, and is provided with an island platform serving two tracks
This station is located in the underground of the crossing of Karasuma-dori and Marutamachi-dori streets, and is provided with an island platform serving two tracks.
This station is located in the underground of the crossing of Karasuma-dori and Marutamachi-dori streets, and is provided with an island platform serving two tracks.

sen.j: 改札は有人改札口が国際会館寄りの北側に、無人改札口が竹田寄りの南側にある。
sen.e: As for the entrance/exit gates, a manned one is located on the north side or on the Kokusaikaikan (the international conference hall) side and an unmanned one on the south side or on the Takeda side.

As for the entrance/exit gates, a manned one is located on the north side or on the Kokusaikaikan (the international conference hall) side and an unmanned one is found on the south side (the Takeda side).

As for the entrance/exit gates, a manned one is located on the north side or on the Kokusaikaikan (the international conference hall) side and an unmanned one is found on the south side (the Takeda side).

sen.j: 1～4番出口へは有人改札口、6・7番出口は無人改札口、5番出口は丁度中間にある。
sen.e: Exits 1 to 4 are placed nearer to the manned entrance/exit gate, exits 6 and 7 to the unmanned entrance/exit gate, and exit 5 was placed at the mid-point between the gates.
Exits 1 to 4 are placed nearer to the manned entrance/exit gate, exits 6 and 7 are nearer to the unmanned entrance/exit gate, and exit 5 is midway between the gates.
Exits 1 to 4 are placed nearer to the manned entrance/exit gate, exits 6 and 7 are nearer to the unmanned entrance/exit gate, and exit 5 is midway between the gates.

tit.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 烏丸丸太町交差点へは今出川・国際会館寄りの北側の1～4番出口へ。
sen.e: For the Karasuma-Marutamachi crossing, use exit 1 to exit 4 on the north side or on the Imadegawa/Kokusaikaikan side.
For the Karasuma-Marutamachi crossing, use any of the exits 1 to exit 4 on the north side or the Imadegawa/Kokusaikaikan side.
For the Karasuma-Marutamachi crossing, use any of the exit 1 to exit 4 on the north side or the Imadegawa/Kokusaikaikan side.

sen.j: 京阪鴨東線の丸太町駅_(京阪)とは1kmほど離れている。
sen.e: Marutamachi Station (Keihan) on Keihan Oto Line is located about 1 km apart from this station.
Marutamachi Station (Keihan), on the Keihan Oto Line, is located about 1 km from this station.
Marutamachi Station (Keihan), on the Keihan Oto Line, is located about one kilometer from this station.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: なお、2008年10月19日に京阪の駅は「神宮丸太町駅」に改称する予定。
sen.e: The name of Marutamachi Station on the Keihan line is scheduled to be changed to Jingu-Marutamachi Station on October 19, 2008.
The name of Marutamachi Station on the Keihan line was scheduled to be changed to Jingu-Marutamachi Station on October 19, 2008.
sen.cmt: I've changed this to past tense.
sen.e: The name of Marutamachi Station on the Keihan line was scheduled to be changed to Jingu-Marutamachi Station on October 19, 2008.

sen.j: 丸太町通と烏丸通との交差点にある。
sen.e: Located at the crossing between Marutamachi-dori Street and Karasuma-dori Street.
It is located at the crossing between Marutamachi-dori Street and Karasuma-dori Street.
It is located at the crossing between Marutamachi-dori Street and Karasuma-dori Street.

sen.j: 最寄出口は1番出口。
sen.e: Nearest from exit 1.

sen.j: 10号系統 (京都市営バス)：（河原町丸太町経由）河原町駅 (京都府)・四条駅 (京阪)まわり、三条京阪行／（北野天満宮経由）宇多野・山越行
sen.e: Route 10 (Kyoto City Bus): bound for Sanjo Station through Kawaramachi Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Shijo Station Keihan) (via Kawaramachi and Marutamachi)/ for Utano and Yamagoe (via Kitano Temman-gu shrine)

Route 10 (Kyoto City Bus): Bound for Sanjo Station through Kawaramachi Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Shijo Station Keihan) (via Kawaramachi and Marutamachi) and/or Utano and Yamagoe (via Kitano Temman-gu shrine)

Route 10 (Kyoto City Bus): Bound for Sanjo Keihan through Kawaramachi Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Shijo Station (Keihan) (via Kawaramachi and Marutamachi) / Utano and Yamagoe (via Kitano Tenman-gu shrine)
sen.cmt: 三条駅→三条京阪 としました。Tenman-guとしました。

sen.j: 65号系統 (京都市営バス)：（熊野神社経由）岩倉操車場行／（烏丸通経由）四条駅 (京都市営地下鉄)行

sen.cmt: city→ municipalとしました。他ファイルと統一し、and or を削除してスラッシュのみ としました。

sen.j: 1981年5月29日 烏丸線が北大路～京都間で開業した際に設置。
sen.e: May 29, 1981: This station was establishied when Karasuma Line started its operation between Kitaoji and Kyoto.
May 29, 1981: This station was established when Karasuma Line started operating between Kitaoji and Kyoto.
May 29, 1981: This station was established when Karasuma Line started operating between Kitaoji and Kyoto.

sen.j: 2005年11月14日～11月16日 ジョージ・ウォーカー・ブッシュ米大統領入洛に伴い、駅ロッカー及び1番出口を閉鎖。
sen.e: Through the 14th to 16th of November, 2005, use of the lockers and exit 1 of the station was stopped corresponding to the US president George W. BUSH's visit to Kyoto.
During the period of November 14 - 16, 2005, the use of the lockers and exit 1 of the station was stopped corresponding to the Kyoto visit of U.S. President George W. BUSH.
November 14 - 16, 2005: The use of the lockers and exit 1 of the station was stopped corresponding to the Kyoto visit of U.S. President George W. BUSH.
sen.cmt: 月日の後にコロンを表記しました。
